title: Ticket #1165: GSI_DAEMON_PROXY does not take precedence over GSI_DAEMON_CERT/KEY
description:
The manual says that GSI_DAEMON_PROXY takes precedence over GSI_DAEMON_CERT/KEY, but this is not the case. In fact, if GSI_DAEMON_CERT/KEY are not even set, Condor still sets X509_USER_CERT/KEY in the environment using the default value of GSI_DAEMON_DIR. If a certificate exists in that location (/etc/grid-security), this will take precedence over the configured value of GSI_DAEMON_PROXY. At least, I have confirmed that this is the case for the version of globus linked with 7.4.1. I suspect it is true much further back in time.

Burt Holzman reported running into this problem in a glideinWMS installation.

The workaround is to explicitly set GSI_DAEMON_CERT/KEY to invalid paths.
